definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: The ordinate scale is linear in decibels.
sentences.chinese: 縱座標比例尺以分貝爲單位是線性的。

sentences.english: Over that time span, ambient noise levels went up.
sentences.chinese: 在這段時間內，環境噪聲分貝直線上升。

sentences.english: Not accurate, my mom much higher decibels.
sentences.chinese: 不準確，我媽的分貝要高多了。

sentences.english: The decibel is the unit used to measure the loudness of sound.
sentences.chinese: 分貝是用來測定聲音大小的單位。

sentences.english: When at the max moving speed. the sound pressure of moisesshall not be greater than 68db.
sentences.chinese: 拖鏈在最大移動速度時，噪聲聲壓級不大於68分貝。

sentences.english: Decibels measured in water are different from those measured on land.
sentences.chinese: 水下測量的分貝值不同於在陸地上測量。

sentences.english: The noise generated by wheels and rails was decreased by 9 decibels, which is more favorable for night driving.
sentences.chinese: 輪軌噪聲同比下降超過9分貝，夜間行駛更安靜。

sentences.english: A normal conversation is about 60-70 decibels.
sentences.chinese: 而正常通話聲音的音量大約在60到70分貝之間。

sentences.english: The 2190 delivers a maximum SPL of 119dB.
sentences.chinese: 在2190年提供了大量的119分貝最大聲壓級。

sentences.english: The decibel is related to the exponents and logarithms described in prior sections.
sentences.chinese: 在先前章節有談到，分貝是和指數及對數有關。

sentences.english: In sound we use the decibel scale .
sentences.chinese: 在聲學中我們採用分貝標度。

sentences.english: it took higher-decibel sounds to disrupt their sleep patterns.
sentences.chinese: 於是用高分貝噪聲干擾他們的睡眠。

definition: on call/always available/ready at all times
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
